website_summaries.verdict: Getting your filtered water directly from the tap will save precious fridge space, and it’s every bit as tasty as bottled water.
pros: Easy to attach to a kitchen faucet
Filters out 70 heavy metals and common contaminants
cons: Its filter will be ruined if you run hot water through it by mistake

customer_reviews.title: They just don't make things like they used to.
customer_reviews.text: Really sick of these things working great and then all of a sudden NOT working. It now spurts water all over the place when I try to turn on the filter. I bought this about ten months ago and THAT was to replace another PUR filter that stopped working as well. And it's not the part that connects to the faucet, it's the capsule where the filter fits inside...water just spews EVERYWHERE. Now I have to suck it up and spend another $30 or so just so I can use up the filters I still have...then I will be looking for a different water filter all together!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Beth

customer_reviews.title: Second one in two years to peel and become inoperable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this water filter twice in two years. After a year, the first one began to peel and the gasket loosened so much that water leaked out of the entire element. It had to be trashed. Now, the second one has done the exact same thing. Terrible quality. Absolutely would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Failed water test
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these last December and gave one to my parents. My mom recently had her water tested, and the PUR came back with the same levels as her tap water! She changed the filter and tried again- same results. I then had my tap water and PUR water tested, and both came back the same again!!! People who own this- have your water tested ASAP before you buy more filters! This thing does not work at all!
customer_reviews.author: kates1937

customer_reviews.title: Great filter faucet with no leaks
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. So very easy to switch between filter and non filtered water. I did watch the video on the Pur website first to see how it is installed and was sure on how to put the water filter in the device.
customer_reviews.author: flysunshine

customer_reviews.title: The product is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent, but I would like to know if it has any guarantee, if it was without reason, last night I arrived at my house and it was broken on one side, I live alone, therefore nobody broke it, it is a question, with pressure or by changing the water filters, does the cover deteriorate? I repeat is a question, if yes, I will buy another one and I will be more pending to see what happens, I repeat it is an excellent product, thanks !!!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Arcia

customer_reviews.title: What I recommended to my mother
customer_reviews.text: I wrote this to my own mother: I can't say enough about this water filter. I've owned several, but this by far is the best. It's super easy to install, and I can be easily turned on to filter. It also moves around - a feature they never offered in the past. I also find it very attractive. If I could afford to mail you one, I would in a minute. I sure hope you buy it too. It will save you lots of $ and space, since you won't have to buy/lug/store bottled water.
customer_reviews.author: D Hunt

customer_reviews.title: This water filter fits the bill!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Pur water filter and it is by far the best one. It's easy to install. It looks good on my faucet. And the off filter feature is better than previous models, as the water force for dish washing is stronger. The one this replaced didn't work as well. The water where I live has a strong chlorine odor and this filter eliminates it. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for everyone....
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended and decided to give it a try. I just don't get it with this product. One filter cartridge should last at least 3 months, right?.... I'm literally changing the filter cartridges every 1 to 2 weeks max. I purchased this because I was using a large, take up too much space on my sink filter water system for the past 6 years. I needed a change and decided to go much smaller. I find myself spending more on these filter cartridges than with the older system I had. This is financially not working out for me. No one should be changing their filter cartridges weekly to biweekly.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: REPLACING Bottled Water-
customer_reviews.text: With water starting to become harder to find in our area- We decided to go with the filters and place on sink. We're spending 60$ a month on bottled water. I will say when you change over it's not the same taste. Have your water tested and then use and adjust if needed. We are happy and bought the extra filters as well. IT'S FIRST MONTH- So= for the moment I'm not sure if the replacement is going to adjust to the tummy. - Waiting-
customer_reviews.author: WebladyUsa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work after changing the filter
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this filter since 2015 it's was working fine until recently I wanted to change from my old filter with new one to upgrade with corner and it worked just fine intialy so I discarded the packing in my summer clean up and after one month when it was time for coil replacement I was disappointed to c it working like a woter fountain in my kitchen wetting my counter top all over I tried reducing the coil and adding additional washer nothing apparently worked hence ordering another one with my older model keeping fingers crossed with this one
customer_reviews.author: JAMEEL AHMED KHUDDUS

customer_reviews.title: 2 units failed within warranty, customer service unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: My first unit began leaking water at the seal between the main body housing and the cap a little less than a year in. Getting the warranty fulfilled was a huge pain, but I eventually got a replacement. The replacement failed in the exact same way. I am still under warranty from the first unit, but I have been unable to get a response from their customer service in the 3 attempts I made by phone and their website. At this point I am too annoyed to continue bothering with Pur, and I will be purchasing from one of their competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: To the point and effective
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together. It's the second one that I've had. The first one eventually went up on me, but this one is doing good so far. Just a note for those who aren't familiar with these. The first sign that it's going up on you is when the light mechanism messes up (It blinks red, you change the filter and it still blinks red). After that, you probably have a little while longer with it until changing the filter won't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Taggart Jr.

customer_reviews.title: will leak
customer_reviews.text: Pur seems to have an issue with leaking after awhile. Plastic fittings instead of brass my have a lot to do with it but also seems that internal seal around on off valve will eventually look like niagara falls. I had an older model exact same for years worked perfect. I now have tried 2 of the newer ones both have failed within short amount of time. Bought extra filters but never last long enough to use them. Have changed to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Case

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, cheap housing.
customer_reviews.text: The couplings are plastic and so they crack and break very easily. The filter system itself is top notch. The housing is crap. They’ve got to make better casings, I’d pay 3 times as much for one that would last a long time. That would keep me buying their filters. It would be great if they reduced the sharp concavities for accumulations to build too...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. Horst

customer_reviews.title: Disposable filter and faucet
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these, and it is always the same. I buy them because they filter more effectively than Britta. Sadly, Even out of the box ,they leak. At first they leak a little, then they spray around the area between the removable filter cap, utimately they spray all over the room. I have watched videos on how to stop it. Nothing works. Filters clog prematurely, never last more than two weeks. I just switched to the horizontal one, and guess what? It leaks too. Wow. Who would have thought? For something called " Advanced faucet water filter" it is made very badly. I guess we no longer even expect quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Within minutes, I had sweet, clean drinking water!
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to install since this package comes with the adapters. I am so excited to have clean, fresh water straight from the faucet! I can absolutely tell a difference when I taste the water with and without the filter. Additionally, I love easy it is to switch from filtered to unfiltered using this device. Love it and would recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks exactly how it is on the images. Filters dirt that you can't see
customer_reviews.text: Received the product recently and it was quick to install after reading the guide. It looks exactly as is on the images and was well packaged without damages. Water in my kitchen has low pressure therefore it only trickles when i use the filter. Yet to do a comparison of the water before and after. So far am happy with the product. I have added a video containing 2 bottles of water, coke bottle has unfiltered water that has first after letting it settle for about a month. The tonic water bottle contains filtered water also settled for a month and it's clear the water is clean with no settling dirt.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. I spent at least 4 hours trying to get it to work properly. It is cheaply made and the weight of the unit causes it to have a very loose grip on the faucet. I will definitely return along with the 3 additional replacement filters I purchased. Prior to this unit, I had a Pur water filtration system on my sink for a few years and it just wore out due to normal usage. I cannot recommend this brand anymore and will be in search of another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the Brita version!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the Brita version of the faucet water filter for the past couple of years. The knob to switch from unfiltered to filtered water broke & I didn't see a replacement on Amazon. I ordered the PUR version & am extremely happy with it. It was much easier to install. It's much easier to change from unfiltered to filtered water and changing the filter appears to be much easier. I highly recommend this product over the Brita version.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: all seems good but when I tested the water with TDS sensor(HM ...
customer_reviews.text: It can be installed and used, all seems good but when I tested the water with TDS sensor(HM Digital TDS-EZ Water Quality TDS Tester, 0-9990 ppm Measurement Range , 1 ppm Resolution, +/- 3% Readout Accuracy) also bought in Amazon, the value before use filter is 229 of hot water and 207 of cold water. After filter is 220-221 of hot water and 197 of cold water, no big difference to me. Actually I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these filters that I have used. Each has been reliable for a long time but eventually did wear out. I received the latest in 2 days from Amazon, opened the box, and installed within 3 minutes . . . works great. Would be nice if Pur gave you more than one filter as filter is little spendy.
customer_reviews.author: Questor968

customer_reviews.title: Does taste the same
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install. I liked that it had different type/size of attachment part for possible different faucets. I do not know if it filters the water but there is no taste difference. It taste exactly the same. But what I like about this is the little black valve in the back which switches the filter. I mean if you put it down it will filter, it is up, filter is off. This helps to save your filter's life.
customer_reviews.author: Baskan

customer_reviews.title: Pur.r.r.r Water !
customer_reviews.text: In a nutshell, this product is - - Easy to install. - Easy to maintain. - Depending on water quality you are treating such as hardness, good bang for the buck. A cartridge lasts us 3-4 months, as we primarily use it for drinking or for hot/cold beverages. Such as Tea Pot(s), Coffee makers, Koolaid, cooking, or other ... so definitely reduces the mineral deposits. Definite taste improvement in the water as well. Would recommend as a cost efficient means to purify your water for use ... Have tryed several of the competitors ... no need for containers that take up space on counters or in the Refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: The flimsiest cheapy product on the market
customer_reviews.text: What a terrible experience. First of all, this is a very flimsy cheapy plastic material product, no matter what color you pick - black or chrome. It does not fit all faucets, especially if your faucet has an extensible pipe. It will hang like a loose goose under its own weight, even if it fits. All cheapy plastic inside out, so expect to break after a single use. Spend your money elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Yet another that didn’t last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Yet another one that didn’t last a year. It’s December, and I bought this one last February. Same problem... slow flow from the unfiltered side. This is my 3rd unit that this has happened with, and I’m now done. No more. I’ve tried both vertical and horizontal models... same problem. These units are too expensive to stop working less than a year after purchase. I’ve read about this problem often enough that the company HAS to know that this is a common issue. I don’t understand why it hasn’t been fixed. It’s a nice unit when it works. PUR... why don’t you fix this?
customer_reviews.author: GreenEyedMonster

customer_reviews.title: Slow Flow and short filter life span.
customer_reviews.text: The filter system worked fine for about a month and then the slow flow started. It would take forever just to fill a glass of water. So, I changed the filter. Again, it worked fine for a month, then super slow flow. You don't get the time out of your filters like they said. Each filter is supposed to last 3 months but you have to change it every month just to get around the slow flow problem and that gets super expensive. Not worth it. Just go with a Brita filter dispenser and put it in your fridge. Works much better. No slow flow problems and you get a longer life span out of your filters.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sulzen

customer_reviews.title: Cracked within 7 mos
customer_reviews.text: I have had Pur filters for years. I was so excited when I moved into a place that I could use one again - the only thing that excited me about this place. But they aren’t making the faucet mount like they used to. The chamber that holds the filter cracked after only 6-7 months. This is ridiculous. And crappy for the consumer. The water quality with them Pur filter is second only to a filter that has to be installed at the source.
customer_reviews.author: tmr516

customer_reviews.title: No longer a satisfactory product
customer_reviews.text: We've been having bad luck with these water filters the past couple of years. Up until then, we felt we were getting pretty good bang for our buck. They now leak sooner, crack and the light indicator has stopped working on this one. So, we can't tell when the filter needs changing anymore. This new one has only been on for 6 weeks. Have they started making them with even more inferior materials? Don't know what we'll do now that this system is failing us.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke after a month I tried to change the filter , i the filter wouldn't unscrew And the white under cap broke , I'm unable to install the replacement filter complete garbage I obviously received a used brita
customer_reviews.author: gloria Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Vertical style is better long term quality than the horizontal style? -- time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: I had this style system for 15+ years. When we upgraded to a new faucet I changed to the horizontal style. These PUR units have a respectable 24 month warranty and my older vertical units lasted many years. The 1st one failed with leaking from the body after 20 months. The provided replacement failed in the same fashion after 12 months. Rather than go to warranty-war over that, I purchased the vertical style in anticipation of long true service that I had expected (3.5 years ago).
customer_reviews.author: MikeR

customer_reviews.title: Solved SPRAY/LEAK issue @ faucet
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced after 3yrs, had same issue as several reviewers of spraying/leaking at juncture of faucet. Realized it's from adjusting the faucet by holding/pushing on the PUR apparatus. Hoping this one lasts longer, now that we're taking care to adjust faucet, itself, and not push on PUR unnecessarily. FYI - heavy-duty use, I get 34+ days from a filter, now that I know what's in Fort Worth water (several gallons daily for water, plus tea, coffee & rare times I boil).
customer_reviews.author: BougieBoho

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste. Great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: This product was extremely easy to Mount onto my Faucet. They even include attachments if your faucet isn't low enough profile. The packaging was professional, and the instructions were a breeze. So, I was disappointed when the Water itself tasted so foul I couldn't even drink the sip I took, I had to spit it out. My Brother's an engineer, and helped me mount the Filtration system, so I know I did it properly.. but I couldn't get past the bad taste and had to return this item. Thankfully, I got a full refund from Amazon's great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Two Years Later
customer_reviews.text: This item is easy to install and the filters last a decent amount of time, thought the constant replacement of them is obviously an expensive part of this filtration solution. Perhaps most annoying, after two years of usage the item leaks from every seam, it’s cheap plastic parts showing their wear. The price point implies an initial “investment” and shouldn’t need to be replaced after a few years. I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: flipside1

customer_reviews.title: Bought Silver filter - it works - BUT
customer_reviews.text: I found this filter easy to install and it looks pretty good. However it is not made of metal, it is just shiny painted plastic. It works pretty well but the water output through the filter is about 1/2 what I get out of the non-filtered outlet. I like the convenience of the switch, and I am glad I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katymom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: So far I love everything about it. It looks good, doesn't leak, easy to install and use. Most I am happy with the way the water tastes. No more buying water at the store. If you buy bottled water it has a metal taste to it, this doesn't't! My main beverage of any given day is water and I want it to taste like pure water, nothing else and now I have it.
customer_reviews.author: kpd

customer_reviews.title: Great Company and Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product and company. This product simply works. It filters tap water and does it very well. You can taste the difference. I like to "saw" the used cartridges in two just to see what they filtered out. In my case lots of "rust particles" from the pipes. And that is only what I can see. The company is also fantastic. My first one of these I did not even buy. It came with the house. The plastic connector broke, so I went to their website to and they sent me a new metal one free of charge... not even shipping. Obviously, this endeared me to them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Frost

customer_reviews.title: was great and now useless
customer_reviews.text: Was glad to have gotten this type filter. It was more out of the way for use of the sink and faucet than other PURs I've had. It's been almost four months now and it is leaking at the seam. I've replaced the filter. I've used plumbers tape to help the seal. It is still leaking. Which makes its USELESS!
customer_reviews.author: ZoeZozi

customer_reviews.title: save a bundle on bottled water. i love it, removed horrible city water taste.
customer_reviews.text: my home city water is terrible. this cured it. I now refill my plastic water bottles a few times using this instead of just buying more and more water bottles and throwing them away. its easy to install, I love the easy swivel feature, snaps on/off ONLY slight draw back, is the battery for the light, is permanently installed. no way to replace it when it burns out. So you will get 2-3 yrs ( Maybe longer ) depending on usage before it burns out. you can still USE the faucet same as before, just might have to keep track of when you replace the filters, like you used to have to do before these monitoring systems came with these.
customer_reviews.author: david penna

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere, this is a terribly designed product!
customer_reviews.text: I was half-expecting that maybe I would have a bit of a leak at the faucet, so I ordered an extra set of adapters from the manufacturer, before installing, just in case. Well, the adapter worked fine, but this spouts water from the filter housing where the top screws off. I adjusted the filter several times, made sure the lid was tightly screwed on each time, but still every time I tried to filter the water, it leaked from the filter housing. Returned...think I am going to go with a pitcher filtering system instead because this thing is a monstrosity!
customer_reviews.author: ANZicCO

customer_reviews.title: Brand new filter did not work
customer_reviews.text: I usually have no issues with this filter, but I bought 2 packs which is equal to 6 filters and I have already used 3. 1 out of 3 filters did not work. I attached the filter to the hub and it simply did not spew water out like it normally does. Then, I proceeded to disassemble and reassemble and it did not work. I finally gave up and tried and new filter to try to figure out if it was the hub or the filter. It turned out to be the filter. I'm not quite sure how to get a refund or prove that one filter did not work, but I guess this one is on me.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and only lasted a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: The reviews that say this leaks are correct. It does leak. It appears that it leans down on one side and when it fills with water, it leaks. I Just lift the side up that is leaking to make it stop, but is a pain. I remove this from my faucet when I'm not using it. It is a disappointment because this is my third PUR filter system and none of them leaked. ****NOTE: I have had this a little over a year and the light has already stopped working so I don't know if it is still filtering the water or not. Only alternative is to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lavo

customer_reviews.title: Does not filter properly to under 100 particles per million
customer_reviews.text: Our city water is 175 particles per million. I tested after running the filter for 5 minutes which is what the instructions say and even a bit longer and water only filtered to 141 pars per million. I would not recommend this product. I’m probably gonna skip this filter and get another one.
customer_reviews.author: ana amaro

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased the horizontal filter, which is rubbish--you can't change its filter and have it working again! Fortunately, THIS style faucet filter has been a consistently good product every time I purchase it. The only complaint I have is each system only lasts 3 years at most. This is my sixth unit purchased since 2003.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy B. Barber

customer_reviews.title: then it was good to go
customer_reviews.text: We've had a hard time getting rid of the plastic taste and smell from our RV's kitchen faucet, even with an external charcoal filter. This pur filter finally got rid of it! It comes with fittings for nearly every faucet, even RV faucets! Due to the design of our faucet I did have to trim part of this filter so it would "click" into place, then it was good to go. I may use one of the included adapters on our kitchen sink in the house so I can use the filter when we're at home.
customer_reviews.author: DRGW SD40T-2

customer_reviews.title: Water flow is just a trickle
customer_reviews.text: First we were surprised how large this thing is hanging off the kitchen faucet. When we tried it we were very surprised how the filtered water is just a trickle. It would take a minute to fill a glass let alone a pitcher of ice tea. We returned it because of the ultra slow water flowing out of it when filtering.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: A good filter but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Pur faucet filters for years. They are easy to install and replace the filter elements. The water tastes good and they seem to do a pretty good job. The only complaint I have is that the filter bodies don't seem to last very long. Some designs have lasted only a few months; this particular model lasted about a year before it started leaking through cracks that developed in the plastic. I don't know if they will ever create a filter that is more durable, but since this is the only device like it on the market, I guess I'll keep using them.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Had one for 6 years before needed replacement
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where the water is very calcified and these things get their work and usage. I had my last one for 6 years and used it for EVERYTHING. Then, it just ceased up and quit running water through it at all. Some people say these are a hoax. I can tell you they are not as far as removing crap from the water. I ran one glass without the PUR water filter on it. And another after the filter was purged and put them side by side, the glass without was a bit cloudy and the one with the filter was not. Ill take my chances on the filter.
customer_reviews.author: fatguyinalilcoat

customer_reviews.title: worked great for about a month then another No flow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and had trouble right from the start with a "No flow" meaning water wouldn't run thru it, Contacted them and they sent me a replacement,Just asked that I send the malfunctioning one back in the box the new one came in, worked great for about a month then another No flow, they sent a replacement Fast forward to the present and again i have a No flow situation,This time I had to pay for a new one 1st and then Ill have to ship the non functioning one back at my expense, Save you money and look for a better product, I am
customer_reviews.author: Howard Bingley

customer_reviews.title: Works great! We have well water so we kept purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We have well water so we kept purchasing re-filled water from a local store. I had the well water checked for bacteria and after that came back clean we went ahead and purchased this. Our well water has a pretty strong sulfur smell so it turned us off from drinking it for 3 years. Once we began using this filter system all we drink it our well water. Cannot taste or smell and sulfur and find that our water tastes better than the municipal one from the store. Installation was also super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff

customer_reviews.title: works fine but very hard to work around in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: The filter works great, only draw back I found is we have an off brand faucet that it does not fit really well on and it sprays water when you switch over to filtered water . It takes longer to use the filter water because of the lack of about half the normal water coming out . It is rather hard to fill up pans pots and pitchers with the filtered water because the filter sitts so low even if you are just using regular water it makes it hard having the filter on the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: wisedavidsgirl121484

customer_reviews.title: I got a wall mount water filter for my fridge instead, and my faucet thanked me.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this filter and here's why: Over time the increased water pressure that occurs when selecting the filter setting has blown the rubber seal inside the base of the sink faucet, and now I have to replace the faucet. The increased water pressure seems to occur because of the bottleneck effect. I like filtered water so I shall install a wall mount filter in the fridge water line instead and get filtered water that way. There aren't any vulnerable rubber seals in the fridge water line.
customer_reviews.author: The Emerald Garden Landscape Painter

customer_reviews.title: Saggy.
customer_reviews.text: With the faucet connections provided, it is impossible to mount this filter so it stays upright like the photos show. The clamp has too much play, allowing the unit to sag. Of the faucet adapters provided - there are 3 plastic adapters and one metal adapter; the metal adapter is the only one that fits my faucet and the filter sags at an angle, no matter what position it is in. It works, without leaks, but just looks bad. After I have used up the replacement filter cartridges I bought with this unit, I will probably go back to a pitcher-type water filter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had known it would only fit certain types of facuets.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been great if it actually fix most faucets. When I purchased it I didn't have the foresight to look up how to get it to fit and figured it would have attachments for different sinks. It only attaches to one type of faucet. Basically donated it to a friend who had the right fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the indicator light on my old unit for the cartridge health stopped working and none of the instructions on the Internet for getting it to work again did the trick so I had to purchase a replacement. The old one probably lasted 4 or 5 years so I guess I can't complain. This filter will not only save you a ton of money over bottled water but generally the water from this filter tastes better as well. The filters themselves seem to last a fairly long time. Use this for bottled water and making coffee and tea and you will likely be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smart

customer_reviews.title: Absurdly slow water flow
customer_reviews.text: While this item was very easy to install and remove, and the water tasted fine, the flow was so slow that it ended up taking about 2-3 minutes to fill one small glass of water. This production got to be so time-consuming that it essentially made it useless. We looked online for all kinds of fixes, removing air bubbles, changed the filter once, but it still was ridiculously slow. Not sure how everyone deals with it....unless we happened to get a defective one. Looking online, slow water flow is listed as the primary issue with this item. Luckily we are able to return it and look for another water filtration system.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Jon

customer_reviews.title: Very slow water flow and gives a greasy texture to the water.
customer_reviews.text: Although it is relatively easy to install, the filtered water flows too slowly, and also gives the water a very greasy like texture. The led indicator is an additional worry since the battery cannot be replaced nor can this feature be turned off. A non electric alternative would be better. It would be an an appreciated detail if the actual micron level of the filter was mentioned in the specs. For those who have a problem with copepods or similar, such as in NY, this is also not mentioned specifically if they are filtered out. I would like to see a counter top version with extended duration and higher filtration capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: MKZ

customer_reviews.title: Best PUR Advanced Water Filter System
customer_reviews.text: Love the Advanced PUR Water faucet system. Can pivot out of the way. Easy to install & remove. Easy to install new cartridge filter. Like the vertical design vs horizontal, easier & no leaks. Please do not stop making this model. Best there is. This is my second one. First wore out. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deb T.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it today, it was very simple and only took a few minutes. What a huge improvement to the taste of my water! I couldn’t drink it at all, as it had the super irony taste as it is well water. The bad taste is completely gone! We’ll see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Sham - Tested using TDS meter.
customer_reviews.text: Had this filter for 2 weeks decided to test it, barely used since I thought the water tasted the same as tap water. Does not reduce the particles in my tap water at all. My tap water rates at ~145 tds and after installing the pur filter the water through the filter is still at ~145 tds. Yes it was installed correctly and even the filter light is green when using. Compared to my water pitcher which reduces the tds down to 0 this is a scam and a sham. Do not buy if you're looking for clean tap water.
customer_reviews.author: newboarder

customer_reviews.title: it makes my faucet jump like if the water has been turned of for a ...
customer_reviews.text: this particular item was defective, every time I try to use it, it makes my faucet jump like if the water has been turned of for a while and just came back on, this is not my first filter of this brand, I used them for years, , but this type with the two push thing to set it on the faucet just plain stinks! if it was not so much problem I would send it back, a loss for me for sure. not sure I want to order another , I may have the same issue?
customer_reviews.author: Ann Fournier

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a little over a year and that’s it. Could be worse, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this May 2017 and here we are a little over a year later needing to replace the whole system. Yes, it purifies water. Yes, the cartridges are expensive and have very short lives but we haven’t found anything else that we like so I will order it again. Overall, I’d say it’s MEH. Then again, we use it multiple times a day, every day. For the value of clean water over the course of a year, it’s not thaaaaat bad. Could be worse.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: These have worked well for years for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this exact item installed on my faucet for several years now, and have always been pleased with the results of the water that comes out of my tap. Many of the residents in my neighborhood are always buying bottled water, when they could eliminate doing it, simply by getting one of these filters, it only takes about 5 minutes to install one, and I'll wager that they would be getting better water with one of these.....A word of caution, always use the recommended filters, not after market ones.
customer_reviews.author: R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed this product, it worked very well. It was easy to install and I was so stoked to have fresh clean water right from the tap. Fast forward a couple of weeks and the purified water comes out at a trickle. The flow has noticeably slowed way down. I tried taking it apart cleaning it and reinstalling it but its still extremely slow. Poorly made product. I would not recommend anyone ever buy this.
customer_reviews.author: SamMillerPDX

customer_reviews.title: Worth the grab
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in our new apartment for easy access to filtered water. Took only a few minutes to install and works well. I prefer it over a filtering pitcher that is constantly having to be refilled. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to purify your drinking water!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for about 2 years and although the filters are expensive, the quality of the drinking water produced is just fine. This is a great space saver and I'd recommend this over Brita pitchers if you don't have that much room in your kitchen
customer_reviews.author: LoveElectronics

customer_reviews.title: Switching to the filtered water worked fine though. This was the second one we had
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't last long. We had one from April 2016 and it broke in February 2017. Water started sputtering out of the main spout as if it was clogged. Switching to the filtered water worked fine though. This was the second one we had. Same thing with the first. What we noticed was when we started turning the switch downward to change to the filter, the water would come out the main spout fine as long as you turn it down about a quarter inch. The quick fix for now was to put a few strips of duct tape to keep the switch from fully being turned up. The switch as well as the unit is very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Balcezak

customer_reviews.title: and it's fine. I wrote the date of filter installment on ...
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one purchased. The first one lasted for several years. I read comments about the plastic breaking, but I never had that problem. I'm just gentle with the lever, and it's fine. I wrote the date of filter installment on my calendar and traded out filters every 2 1/2 to 3 months, or when the stream seemed to be getting too slow, due to hard water build up. I use the mineral clear filters, good tasting water, and CHEAP compared to long term plastic bottle use. VERY easy installation, just a minutes + 5 minutes to prime the new filter. I will purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: It works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Our well water has a terribly high iron content. Prior to purchasing this filter system we were spending way too much money on bottled drinking water. Although it is not distilled water pure, it is noticeably improved to the point that my wife will now make her coffee with "tap" water. We have been using the original unit for over a month and have not needed to replace it yet. The filter is more than paying for itself in savings.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for convenience, since we were sick of having our fridge or counter top space taken up by our Zerowater pitcher (the biggest model). When our pitcher broke we decided to replace it with this. Well it's certainly more convenient and the water tastes better than straight from the tap, but it still has an odd taste to it that our old filter brand didn't leave. We only use this for our cooking water now, once the filter is done this guy is going in the trash. On bottled drinking water right now while we research what other options are best for our household. Installation was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes water good :)
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where the water by itself is pretty bad tasting. I have used PUR filters for years and just got a new one. As always it works great, and the water tastes so good I enjoy drinking it. I use the filtered water for drinking, cooking, making coffee and tea. A filter lasts 2-3 months, depending on how much you use. I usually buy a new filter unit like this every 3 or 4 years, whether I need it or not, just because I feel like there are some areas of it that you can't really get into to clean.
customer_reviews.author: NanaJodie

customer_reviews.title: It is OK but plan on replacing in two years
customer_reviews.text: This filter is OK. We did not have a lot of options but if you have to have a faucet filter this does the job. The one issue I have is it really only lasts about two years and then it is done. This is the third one I have had in about 6 years. But it is priced I guess to be replaced every so many years. We use the water from this for our Capresso coffee machine and for drinking. We live in an area that has very hard water and it tastes bad. This does improve the taste quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Time For A Drink!
customer_reviews.text: My son has kidney stone issues. Since we have switched to the PUR filter he has not had another stone. Is the PUR filter the reason, we do not really know. But, it is one of the precautions that we took about a year ago in an attempt to get his issues under control and so far no more stones. We do have hard water, and this provides clean filtered water for cooking and drinking. The replacement filters last for a couple of months and are a better value if you buy them on Amazon. We have never found them for less at the store. Highly Recommend this Product.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Holman

customer_reviews.title: Look for an alternative
customer_reviews.text: This was the second one. I bought it in February 2015. A few months before the chrome coating started peeling. The the warning light stopped working. In June I realized there was a two year warranty. KAZ the company handling the warranty put me through the paces finally saying. there was no problem as the warranty had expired even though the device failed during the warranty period. As soon as I finish the filters I have I will switch to a competitor.
customer_reviews.author: vanguardians

customer_reviews.title: Great water!
customer_reviews.text: We've used the Pur filters for years. We are on City Water that is OK, but I like the additional filtering. The water tastes great! There is no Chlorine taste and I feel better knowing that many polutants and impurities are removed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Richart

customer_reviews.title: Flyweight
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks good; EZ to put on; simple to use. Cons: Really cheaply made and thin plastic, so lightweight that you have to be careful not to squeeze too hard when replacing filters (really; no kidding!) Also, if you're used to the horizontal holder this will take a day or two to get used to. Frankly I prefer the horizontal. Our four-year-old previous Pure filter holder was plastic, too, but several grades above this tin foil thingie. But it works, and the filters give you clean, good tasting water. Just don't bang anything into the holder. Maybe this will help in your deciding. Drink up!
customer_reviews.author: A Dogged shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: Love this filter system. Only issue we've had in the last 6 years is the little led indicator light going out. It's not really a huge issue though because the water stops coming through the filter when is done. Or city a couple times a year ups some chemicals because of run off, the only time we notice the smell and taste difference is when we're not home using our filter!
customer_reviews.author: Jess R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice PUR water I think
customer_reviews.text: Never measured anything in my water, so this is all purely speculation. I think the water tastes great, however, I never did a blind test. I think the water is clean, because I can't see any dirt. I also think there is no lead or other carcinogenic substances, because PUR says it cleans that stuff off. But I use it for peace of mind. At least I'm making an effort to drink clean water, and if it isn't clean, at least I tried my best. I give 5 stars to those who want to give an effort to clean water. Nevermind if it is actually clean, because I won't give an effort to actually test the water. 5 stars PUR
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year and still works good.
customer_reviews.text: I've probably been using this for 10 months. I've replaced filter once. About to purchase another one. It does take up space though which I'd annoying, I would prefer a smaller design. Besides that it works good. Can't really compare water since I don't drink straight from tap. It's saved me from buying gallons of water from store. Water does come out in a small stream but I assume that's how it works since it's filtered.
customer_reviews.author: Pat An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Installed The Product
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports rates this product as a reliable product in their testing process. We have well water with minerals in it. So much so, it turns the bathtub and kitchen sink green. The product claims to remove a lot of different things. Water had no taste using the filter just like spring water. So far so good!! One thing though, filtered water comes out much slower that the regular faucet. Do not try to filter hot water.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Now a cheap product made with inferior plastic
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a good product but no longer.It is Junk see the pictures of how they leak now after a couple months use from another reviewer.I have had the same experience .The earlier version I left in my old house used to work fine replacement filter after replacement filter.I believe they are using cheaper materials.
customer_reviews.author: Ronzo

customer_reviews.title: Absolute waste of money :(
customer_reviews.text: The life of these filters are rated at 100 gallons, but after around 3 weeks and way less than 100 gallons, the water flow was so slow that I'd probably die of dehydration before filling a glass of water! Okay.... that was an exaggeration, but my disappointment with this filter cannot be understated. It drips at a rate of about 1 drop of water per second, and although that's not slow enough for me to die of dehydration, it definitely is slow enough to make my blood boil. DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Decent filter, but not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Customer service was helpful and when I returned a unit and thought the new one was defective, they helped me by 1) sending a new adaptor kit for the sink and 2) explaining that what I thought was a leak was actually a pinhole that was intentional. They also sent me an extra free filter with the return (so I got two with the replacement unit) which made up for the cost of shipping the product back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Breitbart

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine, and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the stream is not as hard as the older model I had but they no longer make those filters. The stream of water on this filter is slower and wobbly. But it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: love those scots

customer_reviews.title: Find something else
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a 2 star because the indicator light stopped working in less than a month! Also the black lever is very cheap - the whole thing feels cheap. I am sorry I bought it and the 3 filters. I'm just using it now ...when the water tastes bad I will change the filter. I am very disappointed because I had one from the 90s that was still working! This is cheaply made and/or defective. Too bad they haven't found a way to allow customers to fix the indicator light!!!
customer_reviews.author: Briolette

customer_reviews.title: SLOW FLOW
customer_reviews.text: The filter was good now the flow is extremely slow and I am thinking of buying a new filter. I am extremely disappointed it has not even been 2 months and the filter is extremely slow to the point it is dripping.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Bad Taste... Gone!
customer_reviews.text: Tap water in Orange City, FL tastes pretty bad, IMO, so I purchased a Brita pitcher a while back to see if that would solve the problem. It did not. So I went ahead and ordered the PUR Advanced water filter and installed it today. Installation was super easy and I made sure I ran water through the filter in order to clean it. After that, I refilled my Brita pitcher and tasted the water. Happy to report that the bad taste is GONE for good! Super happy with my purchase and highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: — Odie

customer_reviews.title: Pur Faucet Water Filter Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My other pur water faucet filter quit working, so I though I would try an upright, and this one was very easy to install and works great. Really happy....and of course, Amazon delivery is exceptional. Thanks again Amazon....
customer_reviews.author: Judarry

customer_reviews.title: Same issue as other: Leaks after a few filter changes
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other, mine only worked from September 2016 until March 2017. After that point it began leaking at the seams, and now is completely useless. I've tried to contact the seller and Amazon to no avail. I would not suggest purchasing this item until there is a clear indication that this issue in the design has been resolved. Otherwise you'll end up like me - sitting with $40 worth of spare filters and having to buy a new sink unit to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: they send one metal adapter and 3 cheap plastic adapters.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if it would actually do a good job on the water. the install SEEMINGLY should be easy enough but only one of the cheap plastic adapters fit my faucet and I have STILL been unable to get it to attach firmly enough so that it doesn't leak or blow the whole unit off. i thought i had done my homework and read reviews but because of one crucial piece, the whole thing doesn't work. why does everything has to be such junk these days?!?
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Murry

customer_reviews.title: I am incredibly happy I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly happy I bought this. The city I live in has awful tap water, when I got a regular glass of water it took several minutes for the particles in that water to settle on the bottom of the glass. Until it settles that water looks cloudy and the tap water also has a strange taste. This filter completely eliminates those particles and the strange taste. It makes drinking water nice again. Plus it helps me save money on water bottles and help the environment by producing less waste.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Defective filter (the one I received)
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get my new filter. When it csme, we installed it and the filtered water was running kind of slow. I thought it was because it was new and it needed to take some time for the water to go into the filter. But it was slower and slower as time passed by. It has only been a month and some days and the water doesn't come through the filter anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Osaki

customer_reviews.title: Well, that didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: So my unit has been leaking water from above the filter container, at first it was a small stream of water and now it bursts from the cap. I've removed and reinstalled the cover to the filter cap but the problem persists. Can't believe after 2 years the unit failed. I have a Culligan and a Brita unit at my parents house that's still running with no leaks or issues for 5+ and 6+ years respectively
customer_reviews.author: ChefUno

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and our water tastes so much better
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and our water tastes so much better! Our water smelled like a swimming pool and our Brita pitcher helped some, but we decided to buy the faucet filter to use as well. It looks nice in chrome on our faucet, and I like that it rotates so you can move it out of the way when you're using the sink. The light for filter life is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: very slow pour but seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: works great as far as I can tell but the water comes out super slow! so slow that I can grind coffee, get and fight for an invividual filter and set up my coffee maker completely and I am still waiting for the carafe to fill, I will probably start researching either a whole house system or at the very least an under faucet filter that doesnt restrict flow
customer_reviews.author: B. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation and EASY to use!
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely pleased with this faucet water filter. The switch can be changed with one finger! The status light is easily seen. This fixture can even swivel without coming loose since it is fastened to the faucet independently with a free gliding attachment. We highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tenney-shoes

customer_reviews.title: PURly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It broke when I installed my first replacement filter. I followed the (vague) instructions, but a plastic piece broke off the inside when I tried to close the top after installing the new filter. I didn't think it was too important, but apparently it was because now water squirts out the top of where the filter sits. I was initially hoping this setup would be more convenient than a Brita, but I'm going to get a Brita instead. It's more cost effective anyway. The replacement filters for Brita are much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tanzi

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during end of August 2015, writing review on 25 December. It's horrible product. Within 4 months it's leaking water from out side. Tried to fix in every way as explained in product manual, but it doesn't work. Though we are just two people using it and both works so we just used as bare minimum. Not worth the money, don't buy. Would have given zero rating but that's not an option.
customer_reviews.author: sharad

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: These are really great, but sometimes the inside of the apparatus will stick (fixable) & show a false red light. I've tossed way too many perfectly good (expensive!) refills before I figured that out. I'm still a bit salty about that Pūr! Btw, I don't know wth "sheerness" refers to on the star ratings. ?? The water IS "sheer"... It's water. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, never worked from day one
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, never worked from day one. Water would flow perfectly with filter installed in NON PURIFICATION position but once the little black lever was flipped in order to get it to filter water.......flow of water was non-existent. Literally a drop a minute would flow through. I read and re-read the installation manual and I was not doing anything incorreclty. Product simply did not work from the first day it was installed and left me no choice but to remove it. Oh, additionally, water would leak from the sides rendering it useless as any drops that could be collected after a long time would be mixed with unfiltered dirty faucet water.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me..
customer_reviews.text: From the get-go I felt that the filtered water tasted flat and stale: not an improvement on the unfiltered water Then I noticed mysterious puddles on the counter on both sides of the sink. The weight of the filter (plus water) was causing the spigot to sag a little and leak at the base; the water flowed into the narrow channel between sink and splash guard, whence it collected on the counter top. Mystery solved and filter removed.
customer_reviews.author: Vital Spark

product_meta.description: Color:Chrome| Style:FilterWhile home tap water may look clean, lead and other contaminants can get into your water through leaching lead service lines. For cleaner, great tasting water try a PUR Faucet Mount Filter System. PUR water filtration systems are NSF and WQA certified to reduce over 70 contaminants, including lead, mercury and certain pesticides. PUR Faucet Filtration Systems reduce more contaminants than any other brand. A water filtration system is important because tap water may look clean, but can contain potentially harmful contaminants. PUR’s faucet filtration system with MineralClear filter is certified to reduce lead and other contaminants. When shopping for water filter replacements, use a Genuine PUR Filter. Compatible water filter replacements are not guaranteed to offer the same water quality! Use Genuine PUR filters for guaranteed results. Additionally, using a PUR water filtration system can reduce plastic waste and is more affordable than bottled water, helping you save up to $1,000 per year. Plus, each replacement water filter provides 100 gallons of filtered water, or up to 3 months of typical use. PUR is the #1 selling brand in faucet filtration. PUR has been developing innovative technologies for superior water filtration for over 30 years. We believe life deserves PUR water. *As of 6/4/20.
